<<<<<<< HEAD
Prologue, to the Duke of Guise written by Mr. Dryden ; spoken by Mr. Smith. Duke of Guise. Prologue Dryden, John, 1631-1700.
[4] p.
Printed for Jacob Tonson ..., [London : 1683]
Advertisement: p. [4]. First edition. Caption title. "Epilogue, written by the same authour ; spoken by Mrs. Cooke": p. [2-3]; and "Another epilogue intended to have been spoken to the play, before it was forbidden, last summer, written by Mr. Dryden": p. [3-4]. Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
=======

[4] p.

Advertisement: p. [4]. First edition. Caption title. "Epilogue, written by the same authour ; spoken by Mrs. Cooke": p. [2-3]; and "Another epilogue intended to have been spoken to the play, before it was forbidden, last summer, written by Mr. Dryden": p. [3-4]. Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
